docs.snippet: Uruguay is poised to become the first nation to create a legal, regulated marijuana market, encouraging growers and sellers to produce enough pot to keep users from depending on illegal drug traffickers.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay is poised to become the first nation to create a legal, regulated marijuana market, encouraging growers and sellers to produce enough pot to keep users from depending on illegal drug traffickers.

headline.main: Mujica Defends Uruguay's Marijuana Licensing Plan
headline.print_headline: Mujica Defends Uruguay's Marijuana Licensing Plan

docs.snippet: An American diplomat who police say was speeding crossed the center line in his SUV and rammed into a full mini-bus, killing a father of three whose widow is six months pregnant, officials said Friday.
docs.lead_paragraph: An American diplomat who police say was speeding crossed the center line in his SUV and rammed into a full mini-bus, killing a father of three whose widow is six months pregnant, officials said Friday.

headline.main: US Diplomat Kills Man in Car Crash, Leaves Kenya
headline.print_headline: US Diplomat Kills Man in Car Crash, Leaves Kenya

docs.snippet: Paris St Germain's Uruguay centre back Diego Lugano has joined English Premier League side West Bromwich Albion, the two clubs said on Friday.

headline.main: PSG's Uruguay Defender Lugano Joins West Brom

docs.snippet: A stoppage-time goal by Alex gave Ligue 1 champions Paris St Germain a 2-1 victory over French Cup winners Girondins Bordeaux and their first trophy of the season in the Supercup played in Libreville, Gabon on Saturday.

docs.snippet: Rosario Central celebrated their return to the Argentine top flight after three seasons away by beating Quilmes 2-0 with a double from striker Carlos Luna as the new season got under way.

docs.snippet: A gay couple showed up before dawn to be the first to register under Uruguay's new "marriage equality law," but another pair was married first Monday after getting special permission for a rushed wedding at a hospital where one of the men is dying of...
docs.lead_paragraph: A gay couple showed up before dawn to be the first to register under Uruguay's new "marriage equality law," but another pair was married first Monday after getting special permission for a rushed wedding at a hospital where one of the men is dying of cancer.

headline.main: Gay Couples Rush to Be First to Wed in Uruguay
headline.print_headline: Gay Couples Rush to Be First to Wed in Uruguay

docs.snippet: Foreign ministers from the South American trade bloc Mercosur expressed their indignation at alleged U.S. spying in the region and throughout the world to U.N. Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon on Monday.

docs.snippet: Paris St Germain will start strong favourites to retain their Ligue 1 crown but a rocky summer, a new manager and the money being splurged on transfers by Monaco mean the plot has been thickened considerably as the season looms.
docs.lead_paragraph: Paris St Germain will start strong favourites to retain their Ligue 1 crown but a rocky summer, a new manager and the money being splurged on transfers by Monaco mean the plot has been thickened considerably as the season looms.

headline.main: PSG and Monaco Prepare for Battle of Big-Spenders
headline.print_headline: PSG and Monaco Prepare for Battle of Big-Spenders

docs.snippet: Finland's UPM-Kymmene, the world's biggest graphic paper maker, announced new cost cuts on Tuesday and hinted it would be open to mergers or acquisitions after earlier efforts failed to pull its paper business out of the red.
docs.lead_paragraph: Finland's UPM-Kymmene, the world's biggest graphic paper maker, announced new cost cuts on Tuesday and hinted it would be open to mergers or acquisitions after earlier efforts failed to pull its paper business out of the red.

headline.main: Finland's UPM Plans Major New Cuts to Fight Paper Decline
headline.print_headline: Finland's UPM Plans Major New Cuts to Fight Paper Decline

docs.snippet: Paris St Germain, who have splashed out over 300 million euros on the transfer market since being taken over by Qatar investors in 2011, now have the potential to win the Champions League, according to coach Laurent Blanc.
docs.lead_paragraph: Paris St Germain, who have splashed out over 300 million euros on the transfer market since being taken over by Qatar investors in 2011, now have the potential to win the Champions League, according to coach Laurent Blanc.

headline.main: PSG Have Potential to Win Champions League, Says Blanc
